title: Research Paper Writing Competency Strengthening Program for Library and Information Science Graduate Students Using Virtual Collaborative Laboratories

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate theoretical background and practical experience, academic writing proficiency, and research paper comprehension skills required
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service and in-service teachers. Conducts actual research projects through a synchronized learning-based virtual collaborative lab, aiming to develop academic expression skills and research paper writing expertise.

learning_goals: Through 3 or more real-time discussion sessions in a virtual collaborative lab, learners establish research topic selection and academic problem-solving strategies, and develop logical expression skills aligned with research paper structures

Using VR-based simulation, learners complete 1 or more actual research projects in library and information science, cultivating the ability to write reports utilizing specialized terminology and academic vocabulary

Within a mid-term course (3 weeks), learners receive 3 or more feedback sessions from 2 peer learners and an instructor, draft 1 research paper, achieve 80%+ feedback incorporation rate upon final submission, and ensure academic grammar and expression accuracy
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
